sections.title: Welcome
sections.md:
##Welcome

Hi, my name is **Zhixuan Lai**. 

I am a undergraduate student at UCLA interested in client side application and programming language.

I have been developing iOS apps since last summer and I absolutely enjoy it. I really want to go to WWDC 2015!

sections.title: Projects
sections.md:
##Projects

I have played with many client side technologies.

sections.title: Games
sections.md:
###Games

Last spring, I spent a lot of time on learning [Unity3d](http://unity3d.com/) game engine. It enabled me to make mobile multiplayer games using AR and VR technologies (e.g. [Vuforia](https://www.qualcomm.com/products/vuforia) and [Oculus Rift](https://www.oculus.com/)), two of which (Horoscoper and Spacinarium) won me hackathon prices.

sections.title: Apps
sections.md:
###Apps

Last summer, I co-founded a startup called [Axcelstudio](http://axcelstudio.strikingly.com/) and got accepted into [StartupUCLA](http://startupucla.com/) summer accelerator, a ten-week program during which I and my co-founders developed two apps, connected with alumni and pitched at VC firms including Lightspeed Venture Partners and DFJ venture.

sections.title: Code
sections.md:
###Open Source

Last fall, I open sourced some of the UI components I wrote and received great feedbacks. ZLSwipeableView, a tinder like interface developed for Murmur, made me a monthly trending Objective-C developer on Github.

sections.title: Research
sections.md:
###Research

Most recently, I intern at Communication Design Group, working with [Alex Warth](http://www.tinlizzie.org/~awarth/) on a Prolog visualizer. The Prolog visualizer is a totally awesome tool that provides step by step visualization of prolog search tree. Alex and I tried to make it the best way to learn prolog and it is going to be battle tested in UCLA CS131 class in May.

sections.title: Contact
sections.md:
##What's Next

This summer, I will be working for Youtube mobile app team at Google.
